title: Election coverage
text:
News Politics Election coverage 
The Daily Press will run a series of stories in the weeks prior to the Nov. 3 election previewing each race and all of the candidates in our area. Here's a schedule: 
Oct. 18, Sunday: State Senate District 1 (Hampton, Newport News, York County, Williamsburg, James City County, Suffolk); state Senate District 3 (Gloucester County, New Kent County, King and Queen County, King William County, Poquoson, Isle of Wight County, James City County, Surry County, York County, Hampton, Suffolk); state Senate District 6 (Accomack County, Mathews County, Northampton County, Norfolk, Virginia Beach). The incumbent in state Senate District 2 is unopposed. 
Oct. 25, Sunday: House of Delegates District 93 (James City and York counties, Newport News, Williamsburg); House of Delegates District 94 (Newport News); House of Delegates District 95 (Hampton, Newport News); House of Delegates District 96 (James City and York counties). The delegates in Districts 92 and 98 are unopposed. 
Oct. 26, Monday: Newport News clerk of circuit court (special election). There are no Hampton-only races. 
Oct. 27, Tuesday: Isle of Wight County Board of Supervisors, School Board, sheriff and commonwealth's attorney. 
Oct. 28, Wednesday: York County Board of Supervisors and School Board and York/Poquoson clerk of circuit court. 
Oct. 29, Thursday: Gloucester County School Board, sheriff and clerk of circuit court (there are no contested Board of Supervisors races in Gloucester County). Mathews County Board of Supervisors, School Board and sheriff. 
Nov. 1, Sunday: A voters guide roundup of all of the races in the area, plus a look at the effect local races may have on control of the state Senate. 
All of these stories, plus additional information about the candidates, will also be available at dailypress.com/politics.
